task: Find the course on Coursera named 'Essentials of Global Health'. Determine the instructor of this course and summarize his bio, note if there are any additional courses he offers on Coursera.
user_action_and_explanation: click on 'Richard Skolnik' to access his profile and view his bio and any additional courses he offers. This will provide the required information about the instructor.
observation: Richard Skolnik is the instructor for 'Essentials of Global Health'. He has over 40 years of experience in international development and global health. He spent 25 years at the World Bank focusing on health systems financing and development, and he taught at The George Washington University for eight years. He has been involved with the Harvard PEPFAR program and WHO advisory groups. Richard taught at Yale University, where he offered various global health courses. On Coursera, 'Essentials of Global Health' is the only course he offers.

task: Find the course on Coursera named 'Essentials of Global Health'. Determine the instructor of this course and summarize his bio, note if there are any additional courses he offers on Coursera.
observation:
This summary reflects only the most recent observations:

Richard Skolnik, the instructor for the 'Essentials of Global Health' course on Coursera, has an extensive background in international development and global health. He has more than 40 years of experience, including a 25-year tenure at the World Bank where he focused on health systems financing and development, and roles in the Middle East, North Africa, Latin America, and other regions. Skolnik also taught at The George Washington University and was involved in the Harvard PEPFAR program.

He has held various advisory roles, including with WHO, and played a part in establishing STOP TB. His recent endeavors focused on HIV financing in India, Cambodia, and Nigeria. He was a lecturer at Yale University, teaching global health courses. On Coursera, the 'Essentials of Global Health' is currently the only course he offers.
